etymologies: early 17th century: from Spanish castañeta, diminutive of castaña, from Latin castanea ‘chestnut’

definitions: small concave pieces of wood, ivory, or plastic, joined in pairs by a cord and clicked together by the fingers as a rhythmic accompaniment to Spanish dancing.
shortDefinitions: small concave pieces of wood, ivory, or plastic, joined in pairs by cord and clicked together by fingers as rhythmic accompaniment to Spanish dancing
